alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goose Creek, Moncks Corner, Daniel Island, Saint Stephen, Bonneau, Jamestown, Old Santee Canal State Park, Pinopolis, Bonneau Beach, Southern Lake Moultrie, Northern Lake Moultrie, Huger, Cross, Eadytown, Eastern Lake Marion, Wadboo, Simpson Crossing, Stony Landing, Macbeth and Old Cordesville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
